result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Enrique R. Casique was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

miscConds.notes: $2,629 fine--DOC collect.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: With Huber.  DOC Agent to determine report date.  Must report no later than 12-1-2015.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Enrique R. Casique

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular (8-20-2018)

Defendant Enrique R. Casique in court with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant requests early discharge. State opposes. Court denies request. Court grants permission for defendant to travel to Mexico. DOC to draft order.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

for early discharge

to exempt vehicles
RE: release for purposed of employment through diversion program

affidavit and order for ignition interlock exemption - Judge Haakenson
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Enrique R. Casique in court with attorney Jack C. Hoag.  Mason C. Braunschweig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  No contest plea to count 1, Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 dismissed and read in.  Sentence withheld, Court orders 3 years probation with conditions:  71 days Rock Co Jail with Huber, Agent to determine report date but not to report later than 12-1-2015; AODA; 33 months DL revocation and IID; $2,629 costs-DOC collect; 1 day sentence credit if revoked.
